me.wobblyyyy.pathfinder2.geometry

Interface Shape<T>

  • All Superinterfaces:
    java.io.Serializable
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    Circle, Rectangle, Triangle

    public interface Shape<T>
extends java.io.Serializable
    A shape is... well, a shape. I don't know how else to describe it.

    The Shape interface uses a ray casting algorithm to determine if a point is inside of a polygon. Click here to learn more.

    Since:
    0.1.0
    Author:
    Colin Robertson
    See Also:
    Rectangle, Triangle, Circle, getIntersections(Line, List), getIntersections(Line, Line...), getIntersectionsCount(Line, List), getIntersectionsCount(Line, Line...), doesIntersectOdd(Line, List), doesIntersectOdd(Line, Line...), doesIntersectEven(Line, List), doesIntersectEven(Line, Line...)

      • isPointInShape

        boolean isPointInShape(PointXY reference)
        Is a given point inside the shape?
        Parameters:
        reference - the point to test.
        Returns:
        true if the point is inside the shape, otherwise, false.

        Parameters:
        shape - the shape to test.
        Returns:
        if the shapes collide, true. Otherwise, false.

      • moveTo

        T moveTo(PointXY newCenter)
        Move the shape's center to the newCenter point. This will shift all the shape's points and lines.
        Parameters:
        newCenter - the new center for the shape.
        Returns:
        a shifted shape.

      • scale

        T scale(double scale)
        Resize the shape.
        Parameters:
        scale - the new scale for the shape. If this number is 2, the shape will double in size. If this number is 0.5, the shape will be half the original size.
        Returns:
        the scaled shape.

      • growBy

        T growBy(double growth)
        Resize the shape by a specific value.
        Parameters:
        growth - how much to grow the shape by. All the shape's points will be moved this distance away from their original positions.
        Returns:
        the resized shape.
